paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a TTR variant associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: neuropathy in all four extremities, diarrhoea, and orthostatic hypotension

individual_records.phenotype_details: neuropathy in all four extremities, diarrhoea, and orthostatic hypotension
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A transthyretin (TTR) mutation is described in a 44 year old French woman from Caen who presented at the age of 40 with neuropathy in all four extremities, diarrhoea, and orthostatic hypotension.

individual_records.phenotype_details: died with a similar syndrome including vitreous opacities
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Her father died with a similar syndrome including vitreous opacities.

Using a 24 bp nucleotide mutagenesis primer in the PCR reaction, a new NspBII site is created on amplification of the variant allele. With this method a 170 bp TTR exon 3 PCR product was generated for both the normal and the variant allele. On digestion of the PCR product with NspBII, DNA from a heterozygous subject showed both the 170 bp undigested product from the normal allele and a 146 bp digestion product from the variant allele. By PCR-IMRA, two of five children of the proband were positive for the variant allele.
By PCR-IMRA, two of five children of the proband were positive for the variant allele.

functional_data.summary: The variant results in a heterozygous state with a substitution at codon 71.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was identified in a family with a history of familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy.
key_quotes: A nerve biopsy from the proband showed amyloid deposits which stained with anti-transthyretin.
Direct genomic DNA sequencing of TTR exon 3 showed both thymine and cytosine in the position corresponding to the second base of codon 71.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
